articles.title: Silent hypoxia: Covid-19 patients who should be gasping for air but aren't - CNN
articles.description: An unusual subset of Covid-19 patients have few breathing struggles, called 'silent hypoxia' and horribly nicknamed 'happy' hypoxia, even though their oxygen levels and lungs show signs of terrible illness.
articles.content: (CNN)In hospitals around the world, doctors are shaking their heads in disbelief as they watch Covid-19 patients who should be comatose or "seizing" from hypoxia -- a lack of oxygen in the body's tissues -- check social media, chat with nurses and barely comp… [+7322 chars]

articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.title: The second virus wave: How bad will it be as lockdowns ease? - Atlanta Journal Constitution
articles.description: As more countries and U.S. states chaotically reopen for business, managing future cases is as important as preventing them.
articles.content:
As more countries and U.S. states chaotically reopen for business — including some where infection rates are still rising — managing future cases is as important as preventing them.

articles.author: Mike Benner
articles.title: Oregon's first known coronavirus patient discharged from hospital - KGW.com
articles.description: Hector Calderon will now go to a skilled nursing facility to continue his recovery.
articles.content:
HILLSBORO, Ore. It was a farewell fit for a king. Hector Calderon, Oregon's first known COVID-19 patient, was released from Kaiser Westside Tuesday.
"Thank you so much for your hard work and dedicating it to me," said Calderon.
Calderon has nothing but grat… [+1734 chars]

articles.title: Family member of employees at Green Empire Farms is concerned about outbreak - CNYcentral.com
articles.description: There are about 300 employees who work at Green Empire Farms in Madison County, and 139 of those employees have tested positive for COVID-19. Kathy Risley from Canastota has two family members who work at the greenhouse. “I know my family member took Tu…
